title: This is the end
body:
Well, today is the day. My last day of real, corporate, benefits-included, paid-vacation work. I have a little brown box sitting beside me that's filled with all of my coporate belongs: a little green buddha, a ball bearing, a nut, a printer calibration coin from an Eagle envelope machine, a home-made calendar, a caricature of me hitting a computer with an amuzingly large mallet, a giant wad of putty, a picture of Nic and I on our honeymoon, a water bottle filled with pennies, a half dozen pens, etc..

Not much more to say. Onwards and upwards, eh!

I think I've cultivated a nasty patch of ulcers in my belly. Ugh.
author: Dan

comments.author: sliqmick
comments.body: happy holidays! now, get a job!

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Jumping over the cliff--YAHOO!  Where's my haaaaaaaat?!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Sliqmick: same to you.

Oz: You pretty much nailed it!

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Don't get ulcers! We don't have insurance any more to fix them!

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body: Ulcers? Tiny little holes in your stomach? Aren't those really Cheerios?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Nic: Ok, I'll have a long talk with my ulcers later today and politely ask them to leave.

Aaron: Yes, I believe they are.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: My PEN is jealous of my PIN, so I won't talk about it here.
